note.p: Clergyman. Educated at Trinity College, Dublin. Curate of All Saints, Northamptonshire, 1858; of St Matthew’s, Rugby, 1860. Ordained priest, 1860. Assistant minister and acting chaplain to the forces, Stirling Castle, 1862; curate of St Philip’s, Liverpool, 1864; of Acton Trussell, Staffordshire, 1865; of Down, 1867–8; of St Luke’s, Marylebone, London, 1868; of St George the Martyr, Southwark, London, 1880; of St Mark’s, Regent’s Park, London, 1883; rector of Condicote, Gloucestershire, 1884.
Correspondence vol. 16, letter from S. J. O’H. Horsman, 2 June [1868]
